sentences.en: 1945 to 1946 was the nadir of Truman's presidency.
sentences.cn: 1945至1946年是杜鲁门总统生涯的最低点。

sentences.en: At the nadir of her career, she was given a great encouragement by his marrying her.
sentences.cn: 在她事业处于低谷时, 他和她结婚给了她巨大的鼓励.

sentences.en: By 1932, the depression had reached its nadir.
sentences.cn: 到1932年，经济大萧条到了最严重的程度。

sentences.en: David fam 185 due nadir wednesday 27 th please meet there.
sentences.cn: 大卫准备搭乘泛美航空公司185班机于27日(周三)抵成田机场,请接.

sentences.en: His fortune was at its nadir.
It felt as if we had traveled from nadir to zenith.
sentences.cn: 感觉上我们好像已从天底走到了天顶.

sentences.en: The demand for this product will reach its nadir within two years.
sentences.cn: 对此产品的需求在两年内将达到最低点.

sentences.en: The nadir of the Hills's battles?
sentences.cn: 希尔斯夫妇之间战争的最低触发点?

sentences.en: This failure was the nadir of her career.
sentences.cn: 这次失败是她事业上的低谷.

sentences.en: When dropping to the nadir, temperature drops is menses!
sentences.cn: 体温下降跌到最低点时就是月经期了!

trans.tran_cn: 最低点，最底点，[天]天底，最压抑，消沉等的时刻，最低温度
trans.tran_en: the time when a situation is at its worst
